package-manager.name: depot
package-manager.title: Berkeley DB
package-manager.description: Berkeley DB is a programmatic toolkit that provides high-performance built-in database support for desktop and server applications and for information appliances. The Berkeley DB access methods include B+tree, Extended Linear Hashing, Fixed and Variable-length records, and Queues. Berkeley DB provides full transactional support, database recovery, online backups, and separate access to locking, logging and shared memory caching subsystems.

item.para: Update perl modules from perl-5.8.8 to perl-5.12.2
Fix a bug which could cause a SEGV in __repmgr_available_site if a site becomes master after winning an election but is still processing client messages.
Build with tcl-8.5.9

package-manager.name: pkgadd
package-manager.title: Berkeley DB

item.para: Update perl modules from perl-5.8.8 to perl-5.12.2
Fix a bug which could cause a SEGV in __repmgr_available_site if a site becomes master after winning an election but is still processing client messages.
Build with tcl-8.5.9
Recompile without -xtarget=opteron for 64-bit binaries on Solaris/x86 to avoid 3DNow extension
